intro: Erodium praecox, commonly known as common erodium, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and palmate leaves with three to five lobes. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Erodium praecox is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
